IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TWCA is an independent, Christ-centered college preparatory school.
IRS990.MissionDesc: TWCA is an independent, Christ-centered college preparatory school that integrates learning with biblical faith and challenges our students to reach their highest potential - intellectually, creatively, physically, and socially - for the glory of Jesus Christ.
IRS990.Desc: TWCA's Lower School offers preschool through 4th grade classes. The Middle School offers 5th through 8th grade classes. The Upper School's three-tiered curriculum offers High School courses for level, honors, and advanced placement. TWCA's Upper School rounds out its academic program through extensive sports and extracurricular opportunities.

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part I Reason for Public Charity Status, Line 2
Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.ExplanationTxt: TWCA is classified as a school under IRC Section 170(b)(1)(A)(ii). As such, it is not required to complete Schedule A, Part II - Support Schedule for Organizations Described in Sections 170(b)(1)(A)(iv) and 170(b)(1)(A)(vi). TWCA is voluntarily including Schedule A, Part II to demonstrate that it qualifies for the special rule in Schedule B - Schedule of Contributors for those organizations that meet the 33 1/3% support test described in the regulations under IRC Sections 509(a)(1) and 170(b)(1)(A)(vi).

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: TWCA holds funds on behalf of others; it has custody of the funds but not title to them. Funds held for others are included in TWCA's assets and reported as a TWCA liability. The assets consist of cash held on behalf of the Parent's Association and student classes.
TWCA has a donor-restricted Endowment fund for minority initiatives. The Endowment is maintained in accordance with donor stipulations.
TWCA's non-discrimination clause is published on the school's website and can be accessed at the end of each webpage by clicking "non-discrimination policy."

TWCA received a grant from the Governor's Emergency Education Relief Fund (GEER) Assistance for Private Schools (GAPS) Program and the Emergency Assistance to Non-Public Schools EANS program, which constitutes the remaining funds from a program in 2020/2021. TWCA also received funds from the US Department of Treasury related to the Employee Retention Tax Credit, which refunds payroll taxes.

All financial assistance requests are submitted through FACTS, a third-party company. Applicants must complete an application and submit copies of their most recent tax returns and W2s. A Financial Aid Committee appointed by the Head of School reviews applications, makes awards, and maintains records. The Committee determines award recipients based on the calculated need from FACTS and information included in the application, such as a change in job status or household members.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The CFO, Head of School, and Controller review the draft Form 990. The Form 990 is presented annually to the Board by the Head of School before filing with the IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: All TWCA board members, employees, volunteers, committee members, stipend coaches, staff members, faculty, and specific consultants certify each year that they are not participating in any activity with a party doing business with TWCA that has resulted in or could result in personal benefit. If a conflict of interest exists, it is disclosed with a complete description of the transaction of interest. The conflicted party then refrains from participation in any decision on such matters.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Board's Compensation Committee benchmarks and sets the annual compensation for the Head of School. The Board delegates hiring officers and principals to the Head of School, who sets salaries with a pre-approved salary pool.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
